intro: Olearia willcoxii, commonly known as the Stewart Island daisy, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, often on rocky or sandy soils. It has silver-gray foliage with finely toothed margins, and its flowers bloom from late winter to early spring. Olearia willcoxii is a hardy, low-maintenance plant that is well-suited to maritime climates.
